title: Location of the general anesthtics in model membranes

author: Pavol Hrubovcak, Joint institute for nuclear research

segmentation: OK, thank you, I'm double check and I came from joint Institute of Nuclear Research from Dubna near Moscow and I would like to introduce you our study, which also devoted to location of general anesthetics in model membranes.
Accounts as well as aliphatic alcohols are well known for their anesthetic properties, but the origin of this anesthetic effect is still unknown.
It is supposed that it could be induced by the interactions between the constituents within the membrane.
On the other hand, or what is well known is that the change of membrane structure has significant influence on their functional properties.
So we set an objective.
To investigate the influence of decaying molecules on the change of membrane structure and so the change of specific functions of biological membranes.
And here is the illustration of a biological membrane, and as you all certainly know, it is very complicated and complex structure.
It contains a lot of features which are interacting with each other and it's the mixture of phospholipids of different kinds and due to its very high.
Complexity of Ariel membranes.
We decided to study the properties of membranes on a model membranes.
So we created to be layers of which were as simple as possible.
It as they were composed just from one kind of phospholipid, we chose the OPC and in this.
Model membranes we tried to.
Introduce decaying molecules as the representatives of general anesthetics.
Oh, according to previous studies.
Well, there is a correlation or there is a correlation between the amount of Duquesne in the belayer and between its distribution and even its orientation.
And according to this previous studies, two theories were proposed.
Our first is claiming that molecules of the cane are concentrated in the center of the belayer, and they are all oriented.
With the perpendicular to the.
To the lipid chains.
And another theory says that molecules of the cane are concentrated below the lipid heads and the molecules are oriented parallel to the lipid chains.
As you can see, the orientation and the concentration of decaying molecules has an impact on the thickness of the membrane, for example.

Well, so in order to distinguish which of these theories is correct, we decided to label the molecules of the cane and to find their actual position within the membrane, which is within the model membranes.
Let me tell you a few words about the samples preparation.
At first we created or we diluted audio PC molecules and molecules of the cane.
Now, in order to in inorganic solvent in order to obtain the homogeneous mixture and such solution, we spread it on the buffer of Silicon.
And employing a rock and roll method we were in.
Inglow books we were, uh, slowly evaporating the solvent and in the end of this process we obtained.
A regular structure of thousands of parallel bilayers.
This is what you can see on the picture and before the measurements.
All the samples very irritated by water.
And in total we obtained for couples or four samples with labeled and unlabeled molecules of the cane of different scattering contrast.
Once we had the samples in the form of multilayers, we were able to perform diffraction experiments, but instead of xrays we utilized neutrons and the reason for that boss that.
Atoms of deuterium scatter neutrons significantly different than the atoms of hydrogen, and this is also the principle of deuterium labeling of addiction molecules.
So from diffraction experiments, diffraction experiments were performed in France incredible.
We obtained the diffraction patterns as you can see on the picture and from certain patterns we obtained.
Crimes like this, so from data analysis of diffraction patterns we were able to say that our simple so were of high quality becausw.
We were able to recognize the defection of 5th order.
And from diffraction patterns we were able to reconstruct the billary profile.

This is because there is a relation between the distributions of measurable scattered intensity and the parameter, which is called scattering length density of unit cell and scattering density is characteristic for each particular structure, and this is good for us becausw.
According to this we can recognize these structures within the belayer.
So as you can see the.
Scheduling density of heads are is different than the scattering length density of end of.
The end of Tails for example, and so on and so on for each particular structure.
Here I would like to demonstrate how we obtained the actual position positions of decaying molecules in membrane.
So we took the profile of the membrane which was corresponding to the sample containing unlabeled decay.
And this is the blue one and we simply subtract it this profile from the profile corresponding to the sample containing.

I labeled molecules of the cane, the green one and red curve is the difference between those profiles and it corresponds to the distribution of the label within the model membrane, and I hope this picture is quite convincing for you that I can claim that the molecules of the cane are concentrated mostly in the center of the belayer.

So let me conclude that according to other analyzes and according to our study for the cane to the OPC concentration, one to one, the molecules of the canes are concentrated in the center of the belayer.
And this conclusion is corroborated not only by the analysis I have already shown you, but also by the.

Simulations of molecular dynamics which we performed recently and they ended up with the same result and in the near future we would like to investigate the different concentrations of the cane and its influence on molecules location within the membrane.
Thank you for.
Attention.
